trial_identification.studytitle: Oral sodium bicarbonate to reduce contrast induced nephropathy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Oral sodium bicarbonate to reduce contrast induced nephropathy in the out-patient coronary angiogram population - a randomised, double blinded study in patients with renal impairment

interventions.interventions: Sodium bicarbonate capsules (840mg) - doses given day prior to coronary angiography and on the day of procedure. This is on top of routine pre-angiography intravenous hydration.
interventions.comparator: Control treatment - intravenous hydration prior to coronary angiography.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence of contrast induced nephropathy in active and placebo groups
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 2 and Day 7 renal function assessment from time of angiography

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Assess the rate of contrast induced nephropathy in patients with diabetes mellitus and pre-morbid renal impairment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 2 and Day 7 renal function assessment from time of angiography.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Estimated glomerular filtration rate < 60mL/min Adults > 18years old Able to provide informed consent Awaiting elective coronary angiography
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: New York Heart Association III or IV Acute myocardial infarction Acute pulmonary oedema Pregnancy Renal replacement therapy Medical kidney disease (multiple myeloma, acute nephritis) Prior use of N-acetylcysteine or sodium bicarbonate or intravenous contrast agent in the preceding 4 weeks
